intro: Pultenaea brunonis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pultenaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions. Pultenaea brunonis is also an important food source for native pollinators and birds.
